result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven W. FENN was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample if one not already furnished.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven W. FENN

records.addlTxt:
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-09-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 03-02-15 at 3:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information filed.  
Arraignment is set for 10-26-2015 at 9:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

Order Staying Administrative Suspension.
Cover letter.
Copy faxed to Attorney Murray per his request.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.    Preliminary hearing is set for 09-30-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Amended Criminal Complaint adds Count 2, Operate with Prohibited Alcohol Concentration, contrary to Section 346.63(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes.    PAC .226%.

It is hereby ordered that:
1.  The condition of bond ordering the defendant to not operate a motor vehicle be amended to require that the defendant not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  All other conditions remain the same.  
Cover Letter.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI - 6th offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-21-15 at 9:30 a.m. Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety, not to operate a motor vehicle and is not to possess any alcohol and is prohibited from going on any premises where alcohol is served.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
